skill.name: codebase-analysis
skill.description: Systematically analyze codebase structure, complexity, dependencies, and architectural patterns to understand project organization
skill.summary: Systematically analyze codebase structure, complexity, dependencies, and architectural patterns to u...
skill.author: AI-Vibe-Prompts

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Describes analysis methodology using read-only tools (Glob, Read, Grep) and local npm commands. No network calls, no data exfiltration, no persistence mechanisms.

content.value_statement: Understanding an unfamiliar codebase takes significant time and effort. This skill provides systematic analysis of project structure, technology stack, dependencies, and code quality metrics to accelerate onboarding and decision-making.
actual_capabilities: Map project directory structure and identify source, test, and config directories
Detect technology stack including frameworks, libraries, and build tools
Analyze architectural patterns and code organization strategies
Identify code quality indicators like TypeScript strictness, linting, and testing coverage
Run dependency security audits using npm audit
limitations: Does not modify or write to any project files
Analysis is limited to local project files only
Cannot access private repositories or remote codebases
Performance depends on project size and complexity

use_cases.title: Onboard to new projects
use_cases.description: Quickly understand project structure, conventions, and key components when joining a new team

use_cases.title: Assess architecture decisions
use_cases.description: Review code organization patterns before planning refactoring or major changes

use_cases.title: Identify dependency vulnerabilities
use_cases.description: Run security audits to find outdated or vulnerable dependencies in the project

prompt_templates.title: Quick overview
prompt_templates.scenario: Start working on a new project
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this codebase structure and give me a quick overview of the project

prompt_templates.title: Architecture review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the architecture patterns and identify the main components and their relationships

prompt_templates.title: Security check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for outdated or vulnerable dependencies using npm audit and npm outdated

prompt_templates.title: Quality assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess the code quality including TypeScript strictness, linting setup, and test coverage

output_examples.input: Analyze this codebase structure and give me a quick overview
output: Technology Stack: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Zustand
Structure: Feature-based organization with components/, features/, hooks/, utils/
Quality: TypeScript strict enabled, ESLint configured, 65% test coverage
Dependencies: 3 high severity vulnerabilities found - run npm audit for details

best_practices: Start with high-level overview before diving into specific directories
Use Glob and Grep for fast file discovery before reading file contents
Always check package.json for dependencies and scripts first
Provide specific, actionable recommendations based on findings
anti_patterns: Reading every file in large codebases without using targeted Glob searches
Skipping the technology stack detection phase
Running commands without checking if npm/node are available
Providing vague recommendations without specific file references

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any Claude Code v2.x environment.

faq.question: How long does analysis take?
faq.answer: Typical projects complete in under 60 seconds. Large codebases may require targeted analysis mode.

faq.question: Does this modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads files and runs read-only npm commands like audit and outdated.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis runs locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: What if npm is not installed?
faq.answer: The skill will skip npm-specific commands and provide partial analysis based on file scanning.

faq.question: How is this different from code review?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on structural analysis, not code correctness. For detailed code review, use dedicated review skills.
